description: Change of use from first floor offices (Use Class E) to one self-contained residential unit (Use Class C3) (Class MA, 56-day Prior Approval Process)
application_type_full: Prior Approval: Change of use from Commercial, Business and Service (Use Class E) to Dwellinghouses (Use Class C3)
decision_conditions: Development must be completed within a period of 3 years starting with the prior approval date.
Reason: In accordance with Condition MA.2. (5) of Class MA, Part 3, Schedule 2 of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (As Amended).

| Any building permitted to be used as a dwellinghouse by virtue of Class MA is to remain in use as a dwellinghouse within the meaning of Class C3 of Schedule 1 to the Use Classes Order and for no other purpose, except to the extent that the other purpose is ancillary to the use as a dwellinghouse.
Reason: In accordance with Condition MA.2. (6) of Class MA, Part 3, Schedule 2 of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (As Amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings: AT23020.P.001 (Location Plan); AT23020.P.010 (Proposed Site Plan); AT23020.P.015A (Proposed Ground & Basement Plan); AT23020.P.016 (Proposed First, Second & Third Floor); AT23020.P.020 (Proposed Front Elevation); AT23020.P.021 (Proposed Side & Rear Eles, Section A-A).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment report shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of noise from commercial/ industrial/ transport sources including associated installations and activities including music events at the adjoining pub. Noise levels arising from the commercial parts of and around the application site should be measured during school and work weekdays. Noise from music or events with amplified sounds at the adjoining pub should be assessed as and when the noisiest type of event occurs. Details shall include the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory tested including frames, seals and any integral ventilators, approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and details of self-noise). Details of internal and external amenity noise levels according to BS8233:2014 shall be provided, together with mitigation measures, as necessary. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site, in accordance with Policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 7A and 3.5 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior	to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of the commercial noise sources and their noise levels, and an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 10dB/ 15dB, as necessary above the ADE Building Regulations value for residential use, of the floor/ ceiling/ walls separating the commercial premises from dwellings. The characteristics of any commercial noise source shall not exceed a Noise Rating level of NR20 Leq 5mins (octaves) inside habitable rooms. Details shall include the installation method and materials of separating structures and any additional mitigation measures, together with the resulting sound insulation value and internal sound level within dwellings. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site, in accordance with Policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 7A and 3.5 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| The cycle storage shown in the approved drawings listed under condition 3 shall be brought into use prior to first occupation of the flat and retained permanently for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: To ensure adequate cycle storage, in accordance with Policy T6 of the London Plan (2021).

| The refuse storage shown in the approved drawings listed under condition 3 shall be brought into use prior to first occupation of the flat and retained permanently for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: To ensure adequate refuse storage, in accordance with Policy SI 7 of the London Plan (2021).

| Prior to the commencement of the development, a Ventilation Strategy Report to mitigate the impact of existing poor air quality for residents shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The report will contain details for the installation of a filtered fresh air ventilation system capable of mitigating elevated concentrations of nitrogen oxides and particulate matter in the external air.
The report shall also include the following information:
a) Details and locations of the ventilation intake locations
b) Details and locations of ventilation extracts locations

The maintenance and cleaning of the systems shall be undertaken regularly in accordance with manufacturer specifications and shall be the responsibility of the primary owner of the property. Approved details shall be fully implemented prior to the first occupation of any part of the development and thereafter permanently retained and maintained.

Reason: To minimise exposure to existing poor air quality, and provide a suitable internal living environment for future occupiers, in accordance with policy SI 1 of the London Plan 2021, policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 DPD (2012); and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
